descriptionSet.description: The image depicts Gandhi on the upper right corner overlooking a map showing India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka. Pakistan is coloured green while India shows a farmer wearing a turban in his field. A tractor can be seen beside him. Around the map various scenes depicting agricultural activities using machinery can be seen. A farmer with two bullocks behind him can also be seen.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: Das, Sushil

description-en: The image depicts Gandhi on the upper right corner overlooking a map showing India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka. Pakistan is coloured green while India shows a farmer wearing a turban in his field. A tractor can be seen beside him. Around the map various scenes depicting agricultural activities using machinery can be seen. A farmer with two bullocks behind him can also be seen. (sp)
text-en: New India No. 2 No. 700
text-en: ECM [publisher's signet]
text-en: Pakistan India
text-en: Sushil Das.

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Lines and colours separate “Pakistan” (colored the inevitable green) from “India,” but note that “East Pakistan” is entirely absorbed into “New India,” filled with scenes from a industrious countryside. Even the oceans—which normally surround the peninsula of India in such prints—give way to bucolic scenes. (Sumathi Ramaswamy) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Gandhi smiles down on vignettes of the patriotic-bucolic (although one suspects that he might not have entirely approved of the presence of the industrial-scale technology in the fields of Nehruvian India). (Sumathi Ramaswamy) (gs)
